Hear<S>8085</S> ye now what the LORD<S>3068</S> saith<S>559</S>; Arise<S>6965</S>, contend<S>7378</S> thou before the mountains<S>2022</S>, and let the hills<S>1389</S> hear<S>8085</S> thy voice<S>6963</S>. <sup>before: or, with</sup>
Hear<S>8085</S> ye, O mountains<S>2022</S>, the LORD'S<S>3068</S> controversy<S>7379</S>, and ye strong<S>386</S> foundations<S>4146</S> of the earth<S>776</S>: for the LORD<S>3068</S> hath a controversy<S>7379</S> with his people<S>5971</S>, and he will plead<S>3198</S> with Israel<S>3478</S>.
O my people<S>5971</S>, what have I done<S>6213</S> unto thee? and wherein have I wearied<S>3811</S> thee? testify<S>6030</S> against me.
For I brought thee up<S>5927</S> out of the land<S>776</S> of Egypt<S>4714</S>, and redeemed<S>6299</S> thee out of the house<S>1004</S> of servants<S>5650</S>; and I sent<S>7971</S> before<S>6440</S> thee Moses<S>4872</S>, Aaron<S>175</S>, and Miriam<S>4813</S>.
O my people<S>5971</S>, remember<S>2142</S> now what Balak<S>1111</S> king<S>4428</S> of Moab<S>4124</S> consulted<S>3289</S>, and what Balaam<S>1109</S> the son<S>1121</S> of Beor<S>1160</S> answered<S>6030</S> him from Shittim<S>7851</S> unto Gilgal<S>1537</S>; that ye may know<S>3045</S> the righteousness<S>6666</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S>.
Wherewith shall I come before<S>6923</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>, and bow<S>3721</S> myself before the high<S>4791</S> God<S>430</S>? shall I come before<S>6923</S> him with burnt offerings<S>5930</S>, with calves<S>5695</S> of a year<S>8141</S> old<S>1121</S>? <sup>of a: Heb. sons of a year?</sup>
Will the LORD<S>3068</S> be pleased<S>7521</S> with thousands<S>505</S> of rams<S>352</S>, or with ten thousands<S>7233</S> of rivers<S>5158</S> of oil<S>8081</S>? shall I give<S>5414</S> my firstborn<S>1060</S> for my transgression<S>6588</S>, the fruit<S>6529</S> of my body<S>990</S> for the sin<S>2403</S> of my soul<S>5315</S>? <sup>body: Heb. belly</sup>
He hath shewed<S>5046</S> thee, O man<S>120</S>, what is good<S>2896</S>; and what doth the LORD<S>3068</S> require<S>1875</S> of thee, but to do<S>6213</S> justly<S>4941</S>, and to love<S>160</S> mercy<S>2617</S>, and to walk<S>3212</S> humbly<S>6800</S> with thy God<S>430</S>? <sup>walk: Heb. humble thyself to walk</sup>
The LORD'S<S>3068</S> voice<S>6963</S> crieth<S>7121</S> unto the city<S>5892</S>, and the man of wisdom<S>8454</S> shall see<S>7200</S> thy name<S>8034</S>: hear<S>8085</S> ye the rod<S>4294</S>, and who hath appointed<S>3259</S> it. <sup>the man: or, thy name shall see that which is</sup>
Are there<S>786</S> yet the treasures<S>214</S> of wickedness<S>7562</S> <S>376</S> in the house<S>1004</S> of the wicked<S>7563</S>, and the scant<S>7332</S> measure<S>374</S> that is abominable<S>2194</S>? <sup>Are: or, Is there yet unto every man an house of the, etc</sup> <sup>scant: Heb. measure of leanness</sup>
Shall I count them pure<S>2135</S> with the wicked<S>7562</S> balances<S>3976</S>, and with the bag<S>3599</S> of deceitful<S>4820</S> weights<S>68</S>? <sup>count: or, be pure with, etc</sup>
For the rich men<S>6223</S> thereof are full<S>4390</S> of violence<S>2555</S>, and the inhabitants<S>3427</S> thereof have spoken<S>1696</S> lies<S>8267</S>, and their tongue<S>3956</S> is deceitful<S>7423</S> in their mouth<S>6310</S>.
Therefore also will I make thee sick<S>2470</S> in smiting<S>5221</S> thee, in making thee desolate<S>8074</S> because of thy sins<S>2403</S>.
Thou shalt eat<S>398</S>, but not be satisfied<S>7646</S>; and thy casting down<S>3445</S> shall be in the midst<S>7130</S> of thee; and thou shalt take hold<S>5253</S>, but shalt not deliver<S>6403</S>; and that which thou deliverest<S>6403</S> will I give up<S>5414</S> to the sword<S>2719</S>.
Thou shalt sow<S>2232</S>, but thou shalt not reap<S>7114</S>; thou shalt tread<S>1869</S> the olives<S>2132</S>, but thou shalt not anoint<S>5480</S> thee with oil<S>8081</S>; and sweet wine<S>8492</S>, but shalt not drink<S>8354</S> wine<S>3196</S>.
For the statutes<S>2708</S> of Omri<S>6018</S> are kept<S>8104</S>, and all the works<S>4639</S> of the house<S>1004</S> of Ahab<S>256</S>, and ye walk<S>3212</S> in their counsels<S>4156</S>; that I should make<S>5414</S> thee a desolation<S>8047</S>, and the inhabitants<S>3427</S> thereof an hissing<S>8322</S>: therefore ye shall bear<S>5375</S> the reproach<S>2781</S> of my people<S>5971</S>. <sup>For the: or, For he doth much keep the, etc</sup> <sup>desolation: or, astonishment</sup>
